items.name: Equipment
items.entry: A preserved medical anomaly (such as a deformed skull or appendix), an {@item herbalism kit|phb}, a set of {@item traveler's clothes|phb}, and a belt {@item pouch|phb} containing 15 gp

entries.name: Feature: The Doctor Is In
entries: If you work as a healer during your downtime from adventuring you are able to afford a comfortable lifestyle for yourself. In addition, whenever you and your allies are in a civilized settlement, you are able to provide them with free medical care and hospital beds, provided they are sick or injured. This is provided as a professional courtesy from your former colleagues in the field of medicine.

entries.name: Variant Doctor: Veterinarian
entries: If you want to play a doctor who treats animals instead of people, you gain proficiency in the Animal Handling skill instead of the Investigation skill. In addition give yourself the Sure Thing, Doc background feature in place of The Doctor Is In feature.

entries.name: Variant Feature: Sure Thing, Doc
entries: If you work as a vet during your adventuring downtime, you are able to afford a comfortable lifestyle for yourself. In addition when you require an animal (such as horses for mounts or bloodhounds for tracking) you are able to borrow them from a client, provided you return the animals in good health. The actual terms of the agreement with the client are between the DM and you.

rows: I talk about bodily fluids and other subjects most find gross, but I do not.
I constantly give out unsolicited medical advice.
When there is a problem I cannot solve or diagnose, I talk it through until I figure it out.
I can never give an answer with 100 percent certainty because nothing is certain... I think.
When I give instructions I just tell people what to do, never why.
I stare openly at people who have medical ailments.
When I see a problem that needs solving I become obsessed with finding the answer.
I speak up whenever I see a person doing anything I don't like.
{@b Reason.} There are no coincidences because everything can be explained with logic. (Lawful)
{@b Charity.} All creatures have a right to proper medical care. (Good)
{@b People.} Governments do not have the best interests of their people at heart. (Chaotic)
{@b Knowledge.} True power over the anatomy can fix any problem. (Neutral)
{@b Mercy.} To take the life of any creature without first exhausting all other options is unthinkable. (Good)
{@b Independence.} I only provide help to those who ask. (Neutral)
I own a scalpel that has been in my family for generations.
I'm determined to find a cure to a disease that took my lover.
I am devoted to the school where I learned my trade and hope to return as a professor someday.
I feel drawn to other medical professionals and seek out their company.
I have a fascination with a particularly specialized field of medicine, such as leeching or amputation.
I have a precious research diary that contains all my medical observations and thoughts.
My opinion is always factually correct.
If you ask me a question and I don't know the answer, I lie.
When someone does something even a little foolish, I can't help but berate them.
I do not have a sense of humor, especially when it comes to jokes at my expense.
I am very worried about the long-term effects of magical healing, but I will rely on it in a pinch.
In cases of extreme suffering I will take the life of patients even when it is against their wishes.

entries: You were a surgeon, barber, country doctor, field medic, nurse, or other medical professional. Healing wounds, treating diseases, and creating medicines for others in need was how you spent your days. While illness and injury make many uncomfortable, they are areas in which you thrive. When others panic, you're working on a cure or stopping the bleeding.

items.name: Equipment
items.entry: A relative's recipe for homemade stew, an {@item common iron pot|phb}, {@item hempen Rope (50 feet)|phb}, 2 gp worth of trade goods (your choice), a set of {@item common clothes|phb}, and a belt {@item common pouch|phb} with 5 gp

entries.name: Feature: Farmhand
entries: When you are not adventuring you are able to provide a modest lifestyle for yourself by working on another's farm. You might sleep in the hayloft or in a spare room. By working this way, you also ingratiate yourself to the farm owner, who gives you free food for your adventures. Before leaving on an adventure you are given enough food for you and your party to eat for a week while traveling and adventuring.

entries.name: Suggested Characteristics
entries: Farmers are defined by the simple life - you haven't had as much excitement in your life as others. Before your adventuring career began, you may have never left your village or town. A farmer could be eager, scared, or naive on adventures, but all are defined by their strong connection to the farm where they were raised.

rows: I really enjoy talking about and spending time with domesticated animals.
I have a catch phrase I use whenever I am surprised.
I often lose the point of the story I am telling.
I have a tick I can't control when I am scared or excited.
I often sing the songs of my homeland without provocation.
I look forward to eating and enjoy every bite of every meal.
I stare openly at that which I have never seen before.
I laugh very loud and clap my hands when I am amused.
{@b Manners.} I conduct myself in public with the utmost respect for all people around me. (Lawful)
{@b Generosity.} I am happy to share whatever I have with those less fortunate. (Good)
{@b Destiny.} I was meant for more than the simple life. (Neutral)
{@b Faith.} I have left the farm to bring my religion to others. (Any)
{@b Freedom.} I want to experience everything I can. (Chaotic)
{@b Knowledge.} I learn everything I can about the world. (Any)
My dog ran away when I was irresponsible with its care.
My parents have fallen on hard times and I have vowed to help them repair the farm.
My best friend is betrothed to the woman I secretly love.
I will get vengeance on the monsters that destroyed my village.
I can only get my favorite food in the town of my birth.
I have a prize farm animal I love to show off to others.
I sometimes wander off without telling anyone.
I am easily fooled and believe whatever I am told.
I lie to others to appear more experienced than I am.
I ask rude, abrasive questions to strangers.
I spend coin too quickly.
I do not open my mind to the ethics and morals of others.

entries: You have worked the land and hand-raised livestock from birth to feed the mouths of many. As a farmer, you woke up before the sun and came in from working the fields after it set. You have left behind a mundane life to seek adventure for thrill or fame or fortune. Work with your DM to determine the types of livestock and crops you had on your farm. It might have been pigs and corn, or perhaps you raised deep rothe and mushrooms in the Underdark.

items.name: Equipment
items.entry: A set of {@item common clothes|phb}, a set of {@filter artisan’s tools|items|source=null|type=artisan’s tools} related to your craft, an iron pot, a book of recipes you’ve gathered over the years, and a belt pouch with 10 gp

entries.name: Feature: Through Their Stomachs
entries: You are able to earn a comfortable living during your downtime by working as a cook. At the same time you are able to feed your adventuring companions modest meals each day for free. You are also able to use your talents to arrange meetings with anyone interested in a free meal. By offering to a cook a free meal for someone who would appreciate it (at the DM's discretion), you are able to get a meeting with him or her over that meal.

rows: Tavern cook
Restaurant chef
Baker
Street vendor
Personal chef
Candy maker
Military cook
Caterer
Cheesemaker
Brewmaster or vintner

entries.name: Suggested Characteristics
entries: Just like a sculptor understands clay, you understand ingredients. You might be a bit of a snob when it comes to what you eat, or any dish, even that which others find vile, may fascinate you. Years of selling your edible creations made you a salesperson able to please any tough customer.

rows: When I eat anything I critique the dish aloud.
I multitask very well.
I make non-verbal noises that indicate my mood while I eat.
If insulted I hurl even greater insults back.
I like to take my time and savor each bite when I eat.
I try to keep things as clean as possible.
I am constantly on the lookout for new and exotic ingredients.
I let others know I expect others to work as hard as I do.
{@b Creativity.} I don't follow a recipe, I improv with what I have on hand. (Chaotic)
{@b Knowledge.} I want to learn everything I can about the food of other cultures. (Neutral)
{@b Hierarchy.} I listen to those above me and expect those below me to take orders. (Lawful)
{@b Generosity.} Everything I cook is for others to enjoy. (Good)
{@b Community.} I feed the people who feed me. (Neutral)
{@b Fame.} I will be known across these lands at all costs. (Evil)
My grandmother had a secret recipe I'm trying to duplicate.
There is a world famous chef I respect above all others.
I'm putting all the recipes I've gathered into a book.
There is no food like my place of birth’s signature dish.
I still use the complex techniques my mentor taught me when preparing even the simplest dish.
I always have some of my favorite herbs and spices on hand.
I'd rather eat nothing than something bland.
I am easily pulled into competition with others.
I try to take charge in situations when someone else is the clear leader.
When I am physically uncomfortable, I complain quite a bit.
Frivolity is a waste of time. I do not like unnecessary fun.
I have a hard time trusting others with tasks.

entries: To you food is more than just sustenance and pleasure. A great meal is art that brings people together. You might have worked in a tavern, a bakery, as a personal chef to a noble family, or within a military unit as they marched to war. Decide what kind of cook job you had or roll on the table.

Something called you away from full-time cooking to the world of adventuring, but you still take pleasure in the craft. Still preparing and cooking food is a big part of who you are how you communicate with others.

items.name: Equipment
items.entry: A set of {@item common clothes|phb}, a small knife, two random {@item trinket|phb}, and a belt {@item pouch|phb} with 5 gp

entries.name: Feature: The Pulse of Evil
entries: You have learned to tap into the residual magic left in your body from the curse placed on you. You may spend a day of downtime in quiet meditation. By doing so you can sense the direction of the closest creature with the undead or fiend type - whichever is closest. Meditating this way does not tell you the distance to the creature or give you any details about it. You simply know which direction the creature is from you at the time you end your meditation.

entries.name: Variant Feature: Pass the Curse
entries: Check with your DM before taking this feature. The curse you had is still dormant within you. You may pass this curse to any living creature you touch. The creature suffers the curse's full power. You may only do this once. Doing so causes the magic of the curse to completely leave your body. The curse cannot be passed to legendary creatures.

entries.name: Suggested Characteristics
entries: As a person who is cursed, you've probably lived a solitary life in order to avoid hurting loved ones. Now that the curse is lifted, you're able to spend time with those you love again, but you've been changed. If you can keep them engaged and talking by asking lots of questions, you may never have to discuss the fact that you were cursed. Bringing it up is painful, so you might talk about anything and everything to avoid triggering a horrific memory. Of course, you might choose to sit in silence and talk about nothing as opposed to talking about the curse. Though try as you might, the memories are never far away.

rows: I ask questions faster than people can answer.
If someone brings up the time I was cursed, I act like I have no memory of it.
I have trouble concentrating on one topic of conversation for very long.
I will fill conversational gaps of silence with anything I can think to talk about.
I flinch whenever someone I don't know well touches me.
I wake up screaming, but don't remember my dreams.
I have trouble finding objects in my disorganized piles of stuff.
I just wear what's comfortable.
{@b Kindness.} I can't help but get furious when people take others for granted. (Good)
{@b Greed.} The world owes me and I will take from it. (Evil)
{@b Order.} If I live life the right way, I won't be cursed again. (Lawful)
{@b Beauty.} Appreciate what's here now because nothing lasts. (Chaotic)
{@b Community.} Good people can help you through hard times. (Neutral)
{@b Power.} The only way to overcome adversity is to pound it into oblivion. (Neutral)
I have yet to be forgiven by someone important to me I hurt while cursed.
The thing that cursed me is still out there.
I can't return to the place where I was cursed because there are people waiting to kill me.
There's a family heirloom I kept close while cursed that gave me hope.
I want to learn to perform the curse that affected me.
I'm trying to find and help others who are suffering from the curse that affected me.
The anguish I still feel is greater than anyone else's pain.
I don't face my personal problems directly because I'm scared of their outcomes.
People like me when I'm happy, so I'll just always be happy.
Anyone who pays attention to me gets what they want.
I'd rather complain and criticize than be positive and compliment others.
Rumors are usually true so I tell them to everyone I can.

entries: You lived with some sort of curse for years. How you got the curse and how it affected you are your decision. You can create the details with your DM or you may roll or choose them from the table below.

As a cursed person you once suffered from a magic problem so rare it's almost unique. This curse could have been placed on you by a spellcaster or magic monster like a genie or hag. Or maybe you caught the curse while trespassing in an ancient tomb or vault or because you accidentally killed a sacred animal or offended the servant of a god in some way. How you caught your curse and how you or someone else cured it, are up to you and the DM.

rows: ...you spoke only in questions.
...you spoke only lies.
...you saw all humanoids as terrible monsters.
...you had horrible nightmares whenever you closed your eyes.
...everything you touched turned to mud.
...all living things were harmed by your touch.
...you heard the surface thoughts of every humanoid within 50 feet.
...anything you ate tasted like sand in your mouth.
...others saw and heard you as if you were an undead zombie.
...you grew donkey ears, a donkey tail, and couldn't speak, only bray.
...you hungered for the flesh of other humanoids and thirsted for their blood.
...any offspring you had were goats instead of humanoids.
...any person for whom you had affection scorned you with unbridled hate.
...any person who tried to address you by your name or a nickname would instead vomit spiders.
...you lived the same day over and over again.
...you could not read or understand any language.
...all animals would attack you on sight.
...each day you woke up in a new body with a random age, gender, and humanoid race.
...people who knew you before the curse forgot everything they knew about you and who you were while you were cursed.
...whenever you tried to speak, your mouth filled with corrosive acid.

items.name: Equipment
items.entry: A set of {@item common clothes|phb}, {@item hempen Rope (50 feet)|phb},a bit of dirt from your grave in a sacred vial, two rare coins with which you were buried, and a belt {@item pouch|phb} with 5 gp

entries.name: Feature: Spirit Talk
entries: Nonhostile souls of the dead can connect with you thanks to the long time you spent dead. You may spend a day of downtime communicating with the souls to learn a piece of information by asking a question. The quality and specifics of the information you get is up to the DM.

entries.name: Suggested Characteristics
entries: You have experienced something few living people have yet to go through. You might be the type who embraces the second chance and loves life, relishing every opportunity and letting nothing stand in your way. Or you might be quiet and brooding, thinking of the revenge you seek for your death or missing the planar heaven you left behind. People who have died often live in one of these extremes, experiencing life to the fullest or becoming fixated on a single goal that gives their new life meaning.

rows: When faced with a new experience the word no is not in my vocabulary.
I always have the loudest laugh in the room.
When I want something I'm direct and simple in my request.
The story of my demise, like all my stories, is greatly exaggerated.
If you ask me about my death I will stare daggers at you.
I treat most people like they're idiots because they don't know what I know.
If I don't want to do something I simply don't do it.
I don't excite easily.
{@b Freedom.} Life is short so live how you want. (Chaotic)
{@b Despair.} Nothing in life is worth celebrating and death is the destination we all deserve. (Evil)
{@b Vengeance.} I will find and punish what killed me. (Neutral)
{@b Charity.} I want to prevent others from dying before their time. (Good)
{@b Mercy.} I was given a second chance and others should get the same opportunity. (Good)
{@b Labor.} Life is short and so I must keep working to make my mark. (Lawful)
I have a great fear of that which killed me.
The scars of my death wound are still on my body.
My vengeance is more important than any other task.
I never wish to return to my gravesite.
I wish to bring back another who died by my side.
Any mention of my hometown reminds me of my first life.
Death isn't a big deal to me. I've died and come back. People should stop whining.
I don't listen to protests before I do something reckless.
I'd rather be mad than solve a problem making me angry.
I would rather cheat, lie, and steal than be honest because none of this matters.
Everything was better when I was dead.
I'm better than everyone who hasn't died and come back from the dead.

entries: You died and came back. This experience changed you and defines who you are today. The specifics of your death are up to you, but the following questions and suggestions will help you determine your odd personal history.

How did you die? It probably wasn't of old age. Spells like raise dead can bring back those who die before old age takes them, but after dying of old age there is almost no magic which can bring a person back to life. Was it combat? An accident? A disease?

How long were you dead? Spells like true resurrection allow a PC to return from death after as many as 200 years. How has the world changed politically, technologically, and culturally since your death? What remains of your family, friends, and personal life?

What was your period of death like? Did you spend time in the glory of eternal battle is Ysgard? Were you enjoying the paradise of Elysium? Were you being tortured in the Nine Hells or Abyss? Do you remember nothing from that time?

Maybe you didn't completely pass on, but lived life as an undead, wayward soul such as a ghost or vampire. Why did you become such a being? What acts did you commit that you now regret? Who still thinks of you as a monster?

Finally someone brought you back. Who was it? Why? Maybe it was to face an old enemy. Maybe it was a loved one who searched for a long time and spent all their resources to bring you back. Maybe you were brought back for a secret only you knew. How did this person bring you back? Was it straight forward magic? What about a spell like reincarnate, which could bring your spirit back in the body of a different humanoid race? Or maybe it was some other magic that has a more sinister secret.
